ratings.comment: I hate math, but Soledad was such an awesome professor that she made it manageable. She really cares about student success I feel like and even though the grading criteria for Calc 3 was harsh, she did a good job to help students. Lectures can sometimes be a little hard to follow because of her accent, but also it's Calc 3 so it's going to be hard

Soledad is a solid lecturer, but the class moves fast. Take diligent notes - even a minute of distraction can mean missing key content. Luckily, Soledad posts her lecture videos online, which are great for review. And tools like Unstuck AI can help with study prep.

An amazing professor who is very nice and patient with questions. The course is almost too easy and has minimal rigor (application-oriented), but I suppose it is just how this course is designed and not about the instructor. Definitely do take another proof-based class if you want some real math.

Honestly she is an incredibly professor. She tries to make the most complicated topics easier by using and perfectly drawing out diagrams. The reason I believe that she deserves a 4/5 is that the final unit is rather abstract and I believe could be taught in a more concrete way. I guess his is more of a math department issue though.

I really appreciated the way she taught calc 3. She was easy to understand and very responsive to questions. The first two midterms had high high 80s averages with a low 70s final average that balanced the 88 and 89 midterm 1 and 2 averages out. Overall awesome teacher and would absolutely do more math with her.
Good lecturer, using examples and pictures to explain materials. Class is super dependent on exam scores. I think they weigh 87% of your grade.
goated professor, very nice and had very clear lectures that were super easy to follow along with.

I took calc 1, 2, and 3 with Soledad and she is easily the best professor I've ever had. SHe explains things clearly and effectively, answers questions well, and is clear about exam topics and reviews! I cannot recommend her enough!

Dr. Benguria's lectures were very helpful when explaining complicated topics. She uses a lot of pictures/diagrams and example problems. The only downside is that the calc department at UW weighs exams so heavily that they're really the only thing that matters. Calc 2 is not an easy class but she made it easier.

Professor Benguria does a nice job of breaking down Calc 2 topics. New subjects didn't feel very rushed for the most part, but the last unit is a lot quicker than the rest of the course. Her lecture style is pretty clear with lots of worked out example problems and general explanations for a new topic. Exams and quizzes were fair for the content.
Lectures clearly and cares about students, consistently answering questions and checking for understanding with ample practice problems and examples in lecture.

Like almost all math classes, exams are like 87% of the class, Soledad is a good lecturer though, sometimes it's hard to understand her if your in the back of the class but her written solutions and explanations are excellent. Exams are luck based, some are easy and others are cringe.

Really didn't like how fast she went in lecture. I would have to write everything down without comprehending it at all because she would move on to the next topic. However, everything she covers in lecture will show up on exams with a slight twist that requires creative thinking to solve. Content is hard but exams are fair (for the most part).

Very engaging lecturer. Lectures mostly consist of a few examples of each topic before moving on, and she is sure to stress the most important details of each topic. Exams made up a large portion of the final grade, but none of them were designed to be overly tricky. Lots of materials are provided to study with as well before each exam

Professor Benguria's lectures are straightforward and she keeps good pace throughout the semester. She teaches most of the concepts through practice problems, so it is helpful to look at the textbook ahead of leacture to get a general idea of what to expect.

Soledad's 222 was decent. Nothing to sway it either way -- lectures were good, exams were tough and required prep. Nothing felt unfair, which is really all you can ask for. Definitely one of the best out of the department.

Soledad is a tough professor, but probably the best in the Math department for the Calc sequence. The lectures will cover the exam material (this isn't always a given) so you stand lots to gain by going to lectures. Additionally, she is responsive and will curve the class if she feels it's needed, sometimes generously! Overall, a good prof.

Pretty average professor. Teaches almost entirely by examples so if that works for you, you will enjoy her. Your grade is almost entirely based on exams, so make sure you do as much practice as you can, and take advantage of the published past exams.
One of the best professors in the math department
Good lectures, but this class moves very quick. Be sure to pay attention and take notes. If you look down at your phone for like 1 minute, you'll look up and find you missed a lot of content.

Professor was super nice and made lectures enjoyable. The class was extremely difficult, but she used lots of examples and definitions to try to help with understanding. Your grade consisted of many homework assignments, 3 exams and weekly quizzes in discussion. She also posts her notes and lecture videos online to rewatch.
The final is extremely difficult.

Soledad is a solid lecturer, and she's kind to students with questions. She projects her Ipad screen, which is easier to follow than a chalkboard. My one gripe is she often changes the slide almost immediately, which can make it hard to write everything down. But, her notes were always useful to reference & she has videos to watch if you're absent.

Soledad is a terrible lecturer. She goes on about rambling and completing various useless derivations, using complicated notations that have no bearing for the rest of the course and often spends the entire class on them. Her lectures tend to be very scattered and useless taking time to explain a formula using her delta notation. Try to avoid her.

Professor Benguria is very organized in lecture, and her notes are easy to follow. She evens posts them after lecture, as well as her videos from virtual learning during the pandemic. These are all super helpful because she does tend to go really fast in lecture. So although she explains concepts well, sometimes it went a little too quick.
Very good lecturer
Wonderful Lectures. Wouldn't mind taking all math classes with Soledad.
One of the best professors I've ever had in the math department. She has very clear grading criteria and shows her patience with students. 100/100

She was only an OK lecturer, which is why I don't give her a 5. But she wasn't a bad lecturer either, and she was understanding and communicative insofar as you can be in an huge entry-level math class. Did the best she could with a full lecture. Overall a positive experience with her.
Hard class, but good professor. The teaching of this class was as good as it could be. She gave examples after explaining what something is, which was very helpful.
The instructor was always prepared for class and very organized. She gave examples, pictures and definitions, along with letting us do exercises in class and working with classmates.

She does not care about students even after going in for office hours with her and my TA. The tests were not similar to the practice ones she handed out but were similar to ones she would try once in class and never discuss again. On top of that the lecture felt so long.

Soledad was one of the better math professors at Madison. But that is a low bar. I went to every lecture-- it was a complete waste of time. She went over useless proofs rather than problems. I struggled in this class, so I joined small group tutoring, which saved my grade. If you are taking this class, get Oumar as your peer tutor. Trust me.

Good lecturer and a nice person. Sometimes focuses too much on useless proofs but good overall. Worst part about this class is that 3 exams make up 84% of your grade. So make sure you do lots of practice problems and go to lecture and discussions. Also many concepts build on each other so make sure you stay caught up.

Great math prof (compared to the awful math profs at this school she is a saint.) Goes over examples that look exactly like test questions, if they don't she moves grade boundaries accordingly. Easy to follow lectures, homework didn't really help but her class felt fair and it was one of the more positive math experiences I've had at UW.

She has a bit of an accent but she explains everything very well and makes sure everyone is getting the help they need. She goes into a lot of detail to explain everything and was one of my best professors. She projects her iPad on a projector instead of using the chalkboards and it makes it a lot easier to see what is going on.

Professor Benguria is an okay lecturer. She's sometimes difficult to understand, especially with a mask and mic. When explaining difficult concepts, it sometimes appeared that she didn't fully understand the reasoning behind what she was saying, which is frustrating.

I was kind of worried going into this class since math is not a strength of mine. However, professor Benguria made the class flow well and some of the difficult concepts became easy to follow. She is also very kind and open for questions so that made the class environment feel welcoming as well. 100% recommend for anyone who is going to take 221
Tests were very difficult with little thorough instruction to go along with it

I truly enjoyed my time with Professor Benguria. She takes the time to thoroughly explain concepts, and although calc is already a tough subject, I feel as if I understand the concepts extremely well, and I entirely credit that to her teaching. I would recommend her to anyone, and if I needed to, I would take a class with her again.

Great professor, one of the best in the math department at UW. All lectures are low on math jargon as she really tries to emphasize how to solve the problems. If she teaches MATH222 I will definitely take it with her.

Took her during the online fall semester. Lectures were uploaded to canvas and were easily accessible ahead of time, some funny moments during the videos as well. HW is typical for a math class, tests were monitored with Honorlock and were reasonably hard, but not too much.
Though this class was pretty difficult the prof was very kind and caring. Her lectures were very clear and helpful. This class was tough but the prof definitely helped me get through it.

Professor Benguria is very organized when it comes to lectures. Her lectures are also easy to follow and were uploaded very early in the semester. I never interacted with her personally but she seems like a nice person. So, I would still recommend her if you're taking in-person classes.

Shes good, although I wouldn't say amazing or anything. Her lecture videos during online semesters were easy to follow, sometimes dragging a little bit, but I would imagine in-person lectures to be better. Lots of online homework was assigned, but it does help you learn the material. Would recommend her, but not super strongly.

Having weekly midterms was one of the worst ideas for this class (online). They will constantly stress you out. Not only that, but the material on the midterms was always harder than the examples presented in class. The homework was very similar to the exam, but that means its way harder than the class examples too so you have to learn from the hw
explain the whole thing clearly and help a lot. She also made some slight changes for students under this special circumstance.
Way better than my other online classes. The lecture videos were straightforward and easy to follow. Lots of examples.

I took her class online during the pandemic, so I'm not sure what her class is like in person. However, she seems super sweet and her lecture videos were fairly straightforward. She tends to give easy examples in her lectures that don't at all compare to exam-level questions, so you definitely need a good TA to fully learn the material.

Imo she doesn't go over enough examples. Im always learning new things while doing the homeworks, which I don't particularly like. She cares a lot about proofs, like she'll literally do a 30 minute video of her moving numbers around to prove a theorem and I just dont care lmao. Also when I go to office hours she can't always answer my questions.

Content is taught well if you write down lecture examples and copy homework down. Weekly exams and homework due twice a week. Exams consist of problems seen on homework and written/printed notes are allowed. As long as you stay on top of the homework the class is pretty easy.

During COVID she thought it would be a bright idea to give us WEEKLY CUMMULATIVE EXAMS. The homeworks/discussions dont cover everything youll see on exams and she doesn't give any review material. Thus you have to spend hours shuffling through "extra" resources potentially doing problems that wont even prepare you for the exam. This is evil.

UW isn't known for having the best math program so shes pretty standard. If you took calc in high school and you got a B or A or a 4 on the AP exam you should be fine. Lots of examples are given so just pay attention and stay on top of your stuff.

I only had Professor Benguria for half a semester, she left before the second midterm when she had her baby. But I enjoyed her teaching style, her lectures were organized and to the point, with lots of examples. I wish she'd stayed the whole semester. Exams were pretty similar to previous exams.
Math 221 is a challenging course, but Soledad presented the main ideas clearly and took time to answer questions.

She's great. She goes over lots of examples. She also gives time to work on problems during lecture. Solutions to old exams are posted on the Canvas site. The exams are easy if you work through the practice exams.

Soledad goes over many practice problems and thoroughly explains theorems. Homework is extensive but standard across all 221 classes. Exams followed same structure as past and were pretty straight foreword. Note: she doesn't upload her slides or her lectures but you can learn the material by yourself by following course plan.

I took two semesters of Calc with her. She explains things several times and always stops to ask for questions. Makes you do problems in class. Do the assigned homework and pay attention in class and you will do OK on the exams. They are hard but similar to the posted practice exams.
The math department at UW is honestly bad, and she is no exception. I ended up teaching myself the whole class, and it was a bad experience. Would highly recommend taking math at another university.

Not good, if you just need to finish up calc classes take them at a different school. If you are generally trying to learn math just watch youtube, thats what will end up teaching you if you take her class anyway.

Hard class, but great prof. Makes you work hard, be prepared for lots of homework and hard exams. The lectures are awesome, though. She's very clear, gives you a chance to ask questions, and doesn't go off on tangents. She focuses on the important stuff to prepare you for the exams.

I was optimistic, her reviews were positive! sadly, I feel as if she was the worst professor Ive had in the math department. She seemed super complacent and had no control over her class. I learned absolutely nothing from her regurgitating the textbook and I felt that she was underprepared. I wouldnt take her for any class.

Soledad is a great teacher. Her lectures are clear and she always stops to ask for questions and takes the time to answer them well. Way better than my Calc 1 prof. She follows the textbook pretty closely.

Shes honestly not that good, she gives way too many proofs and doesn't really explain why or how to solve anything. I hated going to her class because I could barely understand her. I personally would avoid her, I thought she was bad.
The class was hard, but I'm glad I took it with Solidad. Her lectures are really clear if you pay attention and go to class. The class gets loud sometimes, though.
One of the best profs I've had. I had her for 222 and 234. Her lectures are clear and she really seems to care. Super helpful during office hours. The exams were hard, though.

everything about her is bad. I sat in the first row and attended every lecture and got absolutely nothing out of it. she showed unnecessary proofs and had no control over lecture. she was way too quiet and used the slides instead of the chalkboard which made her go super fast. I taught myself the course, only reason I got an A. dont take her....

I thought she would be a good teacher, because all of her reviews were pretty good. I was highly disappointed by her teaching style and lack of communication with students. I dreaded going to her class and it was the worst one I have taken here. DO NOT TAKE HER

I have taken a different math teacher since algebra and not only was this the worst math class I have taken. The tests are hard and are 80% of the grade. There is also no direction on what to study for each test which can add more stress. Complacency is the problem here.
contrary to other opinions, I believe that she is one of the worst professors at UW. she talks way too fast, and I honestly loved math before taking her course. worst ever, and her exams were awful.

Great prof. Has like 6 names. I had a savage TA so I had to study really hard to manage about a 70% average on quizzes but it payed off on tests. She had no control over her classroom so occasionally it would get super loud and math 222 tends to breed super pretentious engineering type students that are extremely annoying. Take her for sure.

She talks too fast and her final exam was crazy hard. I didn't like her as a teacher and I wouldn't pick her again. She goes through her lectures so fast and is really hard to understand, and it didn't help that my TA was little to no help at all. The worst course that I took at UW.

Math 222 is hard. I heard she was one of the best profs to teach math 222, but math at UW comes down to the work you put in outside of class. Her lectures outline the book material and she gives you examples. She was inaccessible to students, only holding office hours on Friday for two 50 min periods during the busiest class times: 9-9:50, 11-11:50

Professor Benguria is one of my favorite professors I've ever had. I took both Math221 and 222 with her and her lectures are very clear, organized, and made the material fairly easy to understand. Calc 2 is inevitably hard, but with all of the homework, quizzes, and one group project (easy) it doesn't feel too bad. She is so sweet and caring, too.

Great professor for MATH234. Not difficult but still worth going to lecture. Not hard to follow course as long as you go to discussion. They say they will not curve course, but always ends up with strong curve at end.

I had Soledad for math 222 & 234. Both semesters were great! Her class average on exams is super high compared to other sections of both classes. Her notes are clear and her explanations make sense. If you have the option to be in her lecture, DO IT!!

Soledad has great lectures, she gives way more examples than most math professors and uses her tablet to project her notes to the class. She allows 20 attempts per problem for the online homework and provides resources for the exams.
Really great professor. Always takes time to stop lecture and ask if anyone has questions. Gives lots of examples during lecture.
Shes an amazing proffessor. She is not only caring, but clear concise and breaks down very tough and difficult topics into easy to understand steps.

Tests are tough and you don't have a great idea of what to expect. Quizzes every week written by TAs. Soledad is nice but tends to spend time on unnecessary proofs and quickly go over the important information actually needed. In class problems make lectures mandatory. Online homework is easy to get 100% on.
Wont regret it.

Soledad is a very reliable professor. When she lectures, she's calm and organized. Her explanations aren't incredibly engaging, but she always answers questions in class which is really useful. There is a lot of homework to do, but 20 tries per problem ensures that at the very least you can google it for credit. Great calc class overall.

Soledad was a pretty solid professor. Sometimes her explanations were a bit confusing, but she gives you the chance to ask questions during lecture which is helpful. Homework is kinda long but you have unlimited tries and you have a week, so you'll be fine.
Super sweet lady. She explains everything clearly and always answers questions. My favorite professor at UW so far. Would definitely recommend for 222.

I loved Professor Soledad, she is a sweet woman who is always willing to clarify things when topics may get vague. The class itself isn't laid out the best, but I think that has more to do with the math department than it did with Professor Soledad.

She was a fantastic professor! Not only does she teach at a good pace, she breaks down difficult concepts into steps and makes them understandable. She doesn't dwell on proofs but instead gives examples on how to apply what we just learned. She is a sweet and understanding person who only want to see her students do well! Highly recommend her!!!

Having taken calc in high school, math 221 wasn't too bad with soledad; however, those who didn't struggled a little. Soledad wasn't a bad lecturer, but she did overexplain concepts in a way that made them more difficult. I didn't put a whole lot of effort, but this semester's exams were A LOT harder than the previous' semesters.

Math 221 is a generally hard class, but Soledad taught the lectures well. She focused too much on easy examples and proofs when there were a lot more complicated problems on her midterms. Two easy group projects and weekly discussion quizzes. It is also homework-heavy with online weekly modules and homework.

She definitely cares about her students, but has a tendency to over-explain simple material and under-explain new concepts. She didn't explain when to use different equations very well. Also, there were 2 group projects that were kind of a waste of time.
She was nice and always answered questions, answers questions and has 2 midterms that are worth 25% each, then a final worth 25%. Homework is easy and online

She's a good professor overall. Her lectures are handwritten (doc cam), and she goes over example problems in class. She takes TopHat attendance, so in order to get full credit you have to attend lectures. She also has time to work on problems during lecture when she walks around to answer questions. Super nice, has an accent but easy to understand
Not very clear in lecture. Does not go over useful rules always, so you have to really pay attention to what shes doing to the numbers in the examples.
Difficult to understand, and lectures are quite dull. Tends to baby us, so I'm not sure how this is going to prepare me for future math classes.

I love Maria, she is an amazing professor. Super adorable and sweet- always makes sure to give people time to ask questions after going over difficult topics and help them understand in lecture. Best professor Ive had!

Soledad was a great professor. She made concepts clear and easy to understand. The class in general is a little harder, but as long as you put effort in and do your work it is fairly easy to get an A. She was always available for students and was one of the sweetest professors I have ever had.

Soledad is a great calc teacher, which is a real find and she is also so sweet! She always asks for feedback during lectures in terms of questions and on in-class practice problems.  The exams challenge you a little bit but strongly reflect the course material so if you study and keep up with the hw and worksheets, you'll do fine!

Soledad is a great professor. Her lectures are very clear and she is unbelievably nice. She provides practice tests which are very similar to the actual tests. If you have the opportunity, take Soledad.

She's an amazing professor.,Really care about her studednts. The test is not hard at all. Though there are modules and weekly quiz, you can try for UNLIMITED time and UNLIMITED number, and only the HIGHEST counted. She also dropped 2 of the lowest. I mean how can you be nicer than that?

She's pretty kind and makes the material clear. In lecture she likes to do a lot of proofs which can get kind of boring and don't really help on tests. I didn't go to lecture very often and still did well in the class. Pay attention to discussion materials/quizzes & practice tests. The final was a lot like the practice final in fact slightly easier

A pretty good instructor for elementary math classes like 221. She speaks slowly enough and hopes to make sure that everyone understand after introducing topics. Patient and accessible after class. She doesn't use textbook at all. The only thing making me feel not good is she sometimes makes mistakes. But generally I would recommend her.
